intro: Lapeirousia euryphylla var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf rain lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces delicate, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in response to rainfall. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique blooming behavior, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
